intro: Pimelea suaveolens, commonly known as sweet-smelling pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in coastal and inland regions. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a notable species in native gardens. Pimelea suaveolens is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
